document.docAuthor: Mendonça, Mirian Nascimento, Rafael, José Albertino & Ale-Rocha, Rosaly
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Brazilian Amazon Basin species of Porphyrochroa Melander (Diptera: Empididae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Brazilian Amazon Basin species of Porphyrochroa Melander (Diptera: Empididae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of
Porphyrochroa
from the Amazon Basin, Brazil , based on males.

paragraph.keyLead: 1 . Mid tibia without long slender dorsal setae; mid basal tarsomere without long posterodorsal setae; tergite 7 without pair of posteroventral protuberances (Fig 13 a); sternite 8 divided longitudinally in two narrow plates widely separated (Fig. 13 b); hypandrium reduced in size (Figs. 13 c; e).......................................... 2

- Mid tibia with long slender dorsal setae; mid basal tarsomere with long posterodorsal setae; tergite 7 with pair of posteroventral protuberances (Fig 2 a); sternite 8 entire (Fig. 2 b); hypandrium normal (not reduced)..................................................................................................................................................................... 3

- Modified midlegs, with projections on the tarsomeres (Fig.
13 i
)...........................
P. platypoderis
sp. nov.
3 . Anterior lobe of cercus projected to the apex (Fig. 4g ); posterior lobe wide (Fig. 4g ).............................. 4

paragraph.keyLead:
4 . Anal lobe of wing weakly developed; hind femur without row of anteroventral spines
P. hipandriociliaris
5 . Ejaculatory apodeme with four projections (Fig. 14 f); hind tibia with long dorsal setae........................... 6

- Ejaculatory apodeme with three projections (Fig. 3 f); hind tibia usually without long dorsal setae; mid tibia with long posterodorsal setae ............................................................................................................. 7

6 . Hypandrium without setae (Fig. 14 d; g); acrostichal setae absent; mid tibia with long slender setae ..........
........................................................................................................................... P. quadrilamelaris
sp. nov.

- Hypandrium with setae in posterior region; acrostichal setae reduced (one or two pair); mid tibia without long slender setae
............................................................................................................................. P. vidali

9 . Mid basal tarsomere with long dorsal setae; anal lobe of wing well developed (
Fig. 18
c)....................... 10

- Subtriangular epandrium in lateral view (Fig. 17 e).........................................................
P. xavieri
sp. nov.

- Subepandrial sclerite without fold at arm apex (Fig.
10 i
) .........................................
P. manauara
sp. nov.
12 . Hind femur with row of anteroventral and posteroventral spines ............................................................. 13

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 21.
Porphyrochroa simplex
sp. nov.
, male, habitus, lateral view. Scale line = 0.5 mm.

paragraph.keyLead:
- Cell dm narrowed apically in comparison with the base (
Figs. 18
h; 19 b); sternite 5 normal................... 15

14 . Mild curve at apex of vein R 2 + 3 beneath pterostigma (
Fig. 18
f); hypandrium with setae (Fig. 6 d; g); sternite 5 as Figures 6 b; c
........................................................................................................... P. distincta
sp. nov.

- Accented curve at apex of vein R 2 + 3 beneath pterostigma (
Fig. 18
a); hypandrium without setae (Fig. 1 d; g); sternite 5 as Figures 1 b; c
............................................................................................ P. aliena
sp. nov.

15 . Hind tibia with four posteroventral basal spines ............................................................
P. grandis
sp. nov.

- Hind tibia without four posteroventral basal spines
................................................... P. pacaraima
sp. nov.
17 . Hind femur with ventral spine; epandrium with digitiform projection superiorly (Figs. 2 c; 9 d)............. 18

19 . Epandrium projected anteriorly and superiorly, with setae on dorsal region (Fig. 7 e); hypandrium without setae (Figs. 7 d; h); hind tibia without long slender setae; anal lobe of wing well developed (
Fig. 18
g) .....
...................................................................................................................................... epandrialis
sp. nov.

- Epandrium subsquare (Fig. 11 e); hypandrium without setae and apex with three projections in dorsal view (Fig. 11 f); hind tibia with four pairs of long dorsal setae; hind basal tarsomere with two long dorsal setae; mid basal tarsomere with two anteroventral spine in basal region.................................. P. n e b l i n a sp. nov
